title: Would watching YouTube on a TV instead of a phone use more data? - Quora

response.answer_text: No. The amount of data used depends upon the resolution and not the size of the screen. The same amount of pixels are used for any given res. Each pixel is just larger on a larger screen. Of course the larger screen may be capable of a higher resolution and so if you are using a higher res on the TV, say via a streaming device, than you do on the phone, then you would use more data.
No TVs as far as I know use data
